question: [File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [TransactionRestoreController Integration] Does the hardcoded VerifyExecutionMode::NoVerify at line 107 match the intended security model, or was this meant to be configurable for production use? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [RestoreCoordinator Integration] Can the RestoreCoordinator be initialized with inconsistent parameters that cause it to restore data from multiple incompatible backup sources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Partial Epoch Restore] If epoch ending restoration at line 81 returns an error, is the database left in a consistent state, or does it contain incomplete epoch data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Snapshot Restore Failure] When StateSnapshotRestoreController.run() at line 94 fails, can the partial state data cause state root mismatches with other validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Transaction Restore Rollback] If TransactionRestoreController.run() at line 109 fails after restoring some transactions, can this create gaps in the ledger version sequence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Bootstrap Coordinator Failure] Does RestoreCoordinator.run() at line 120 implement proper rollback on failure, or can failed bootstraps leave the database in a mixed state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Error Propagation] Are all error types properly converted and propagated with the ? operator, or can critical errors be silently ignored? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Enum: Command] [Clap Parser Injection] Can malicious command-line arguments bypass clap's parsing validation to inject unexpected values into the restore controllers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Enum: Oneoff] [Subcommand Confusion] Can an attacker exploit subcommand parsing ambiguities to trigger unintended restore operations with mixed parameters from multiple commands? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Struct: BootstrapDB] [Flattened Options Conflict] Do the flattened option groups (storage, opt, global) properly validate for conflicting parameters that could create insecure configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Checksum Validation] Do any of the restore operations validate checksums of downloaded backup data, or can corrupted backups be restored causing database corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Signature Verification] Are all restored ledger infos cryptographically verified against the validator set, or can forged data be introduced through backup manipulation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Version Continuity] Do the restore operations ensure version number continuity in the ledger, or can gaps/overlaps be introduced through malicious backups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Manifest Validation] Are backup manifests validated for consistency and authenticity before restoration begins, preventing manifest injection attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Database File Permissions] Does the restore process set appropriate file permissions on restored database files to prevent unauthorized access by other processes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Privileged Operation] Is the db-tool restore command properly restricted to privileged users only, or can unprivileged users corrupt validator databases? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Network Access Control] Do remote backup storage operations validate authentication tokens or credentials to prevent unauthorized backup access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Disk Space Exhaustion] Can an attacker provide arbitrarily large backups that exhaust disk space during restoration, causing validator node failure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [File Descriptor Leak] Do failed restore operations properly close all file handles and network connections, or can repeated failures exhaust file descriptors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Database Lock Contention] Can the restore process acquire exclusive database locks that prevent other critical processes from accessing the database? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [RocksDB Configuration] Are RocksDB configuration parameters in the restore controllers validated to prevent resource exhaustion or performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Backup Metadata Cache] Can corrupted backup metadata cached during restoration cause subsequent restore operations to fail or use invalid data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [State Store Coordination] Do state snapshot and transaction restores coordinate properly to maintain consistency between the state KV store and Merkle tree? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Restore Order Dependency] Must epoch endings be restored before state snapshots and transactions, or can incorrect ordering violate safety invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/db-tool/src/restore.rs] [Function: Command::run()] [Concurrent Restore Prevention] Does the system prevent multiple concurrent restore operations from running simultaneously and corrupting each other's state? (High)
